commentary_data: It’s been 1427 days since Chennai Super Kings have played at their revered AmbuDen. That’s a long time, long enough for the IPL to induct two new teams - one of whom will be their opponents today. Long enough for MS Dhoni to retire from International cricket and retire into a reclusive life, but still command the ability to sell-out stadiums in an instant with fans flocking by for a rare glimpse of their Thala. Long enough that some would have forgotten how much of a fortress Chepauk used to be for CSK - they’ve lost just 15 out of 56 games played at this venue.

Tickets were sold out days in advance for the 3rd of April, and fans have been thronging the venue since 5pm if reports are to be believed. Even the disappointment of CSK’s opening day defeat can’t dampen the mood, because this team at Chepauk is a different beast. They have the spin attack and top-order to dominate at this venue, and don’t underestimate their 12th man, or should I say 13th man now which is the Chennai crowd.

The opponents Lucknow Super Giants come into this game after a thumping win over Delhi. Their skipper KL Rahul has a solid record against CSK, and three out of their four overseas picks had a dream debut in that game against Delhi. The Chepauk pitch could also really suit someone like Ravi Bishnoi, who has at least one wicket to his name in his last eight IPL games. Expect a cracking contest, stick around for the toss and team updates….

Our reporter from the venue  pings that Ben Stokes can be spotted bowling at the CSK nets. For LSG, Mark Wood and Unadkat have been practicing bowling for a while, and even Deepak Hooda. Could he be a useful option today against the CSK left-handers?

Expecting a good atmosphere here in Chennai, everyone has been looking forward to this day. (On batting position) In a new franchise, you have the accept the role you have been given and perform as best you can. Every batter would say the higher up you are the better, but I've been given that responsibility to bat at number 4. (On being fit to bowl) Yeah, everything is coming out nicely. I've worked very hard to get to the place that I'm at this moment with my knee, so might be able to turn the arm over tonight. (On Chepauk) I've not played too many games here, so I've tried to understand the easy ways we can bat here and how to bowl. Spin is going to come into the game more here than in Ahmedabad. Who knows what the wicket will give? So we have to adapt and see how we go...

"Square boundaries - 68m on one side, 61m on the other side, downtown - 75m. The batters will look to scoop and dab. It's got a white sheen and it's got the grass clippings rolled in. Average first innings score is 150, winning score will be around 165-167. Chasing here is challenging, but it's a night game. Will the dew be a bit of a factor? Fingers crossed that it's not too outrageous. Even though it's 'spin to win', if a batter gets in and smashes it to the small sides, then look out, because the bowlers here at Chepauk can absolutely disappear."

Injury has kept me out for a long time. Had two injuries at once - stress fracture in the back and a quad tear. Both are serious injuries. Back is the main muscle for a fast bowler. It's taken time but the body is good now. Have been playing a long time now which comes with responsibilities. And I am someone who likes responsibilities. Be it taking wickets, stopping runs and guiding the new bowlers. This is a big platform where you learn after making mistakes. But if you have someone to make you learn without making mistakes - that is helpful.

We'll bowl first. We want to know what we are chasing. It was a really good performance against DC, all parts of the game we did well. We need to turn up again today and better those performances. Jaydev Unadkat misses out, Yash Thakur comes in.

Does mean a lot to be back here. IPL started in 2008 but we've not played a lot of cricket here. Only about 5-6 seasons we've been here. This is the first time the full stadium will be operational, a few stands were empty earlier. Really glad that we get to play all our home games here at Chepauk, means a lot. Same squad for this game. Need to keep assessing our situation and keep revisiting our targets, keep a realistic goal in mind and take it from there.
(Playing XI): Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Moeen Ali, Ben Stokes, Ambati Rayudu, Ravindra Jadeja, MS Dhoni(w/c), Shivam Dube, Mitchell Santner, Deepak Chahar, RS Hangargekar
(Playing XI): KL Rahul(c), Kyle Mayers, Deepak Hooda, Krunal Pandya, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran(w), Krishnappa Gowtham, Mark Wood, Ravi Bishnoi, Yash Thakur, Avesh Khan

A loud cheer broke out throughout the toss when MSD was speaking, it was hard to hear through what he said at times as well. That's how much this means to the CSK fans, Chepauk could be a really intimidating place for visiting teams this season...
Tushar Deshpande, Dwaine Pretorius, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Ajinkya Rahane
Ayush Badoni, Jaydev Unadkat, Daniel Sams, Prerak Mankad, Amit Mishra
LSG has 9 genuine bowling options today. The remaining 2 being KL & Pooran. What a luxury to have.
Even though CSK Bowling doesn't seem as intimidating as other teams, the home advantage is most useful for CSK than any other team, so beating them in chepauk is going to be really hard

Looks like teams have never left the 2022 ipl! CSK & MI lacking bowling attack, GT as usual making game thrilling and win in last over, Buttler and Yuzi owning opponents, all last years playoff teams continuing their run.
Out walk the CSK openers to a loud roar. The stadium is full of yellow shirts!! The in-form Ruturaj to take strike, Kyle Mayers with the new ball...

A delay before we can start because there's a stray dog that has got onto the field. A good omen for someone? Let's see.. If you'd remember there was a dog on the field in the final ODI between Australia and India as well. That day,  Will that repeat?
Mayers to Gaikwad, 1 run, full with some in-swing onto middle stump, pushed down the ground and mid-off runs to his right to stop
Mayers to Conway, , good length but very wide outside off, swing takes it further away. Keeper Pooran lobs it onto Hooda at first slip
Mayers to Conway, no run, gentle back of length delivery that angles away. Carries to the keeper on the bounce as Conway misses his cut
Mayers to Conway, 1 run, full and just outside off, Conway taps it into the ground towards point to get off the mark!
Mayers to Gaikwad, 1 run, full and swinging in from outside off. Gaikwad gets a thick inside edge towards the right of mid-on
Mayers to Conway, 1 run, full on off, driven to the left of mid-off this time. Another single
Mayers to Gaikwad, 1 run, very full outside off, Gaikwad tries to square drive but gets another inside edge - onto the ground and towards short fine.
Avesh Khan to Gaikwad, , full but drifts down the leg side. Pooran didn't quite catch it perhaps because he made no movement.  Nope, nothing on UltraEdge, LSG lose their review...

Avesh Khan to Gaikwad, 3 runs, full and angling onto the pads, clipped towards the right of mid-on. Substitute Prerak Mankad runs behind it and concedes an extra run as he fumbles.  Bruce Oxenford signalled no-ball for overstepping, but the third umpire overturns it. No free-hit!
Avesh Khan to Conway, no run, pitched up around off. Conway drives towards mid-off
Avesh Khan to Conway, , good length with plenty of width, Conway takes a slash and cuts it square of the wicket. Keeps it along the ground to get his first boundary!!
Avesh Khan to Conway, , top shot!! Avesh Khan comes from round the wicket but goes too full on off, sits perfectly for Conway to bring out the leaning cover drive. None of the fielders even moved...
Avesh Khan to Conway, no run, good length and stops a bit on the surface, Conway tried to dab it down and it looked like he got an edge, but short of Pooran
Avesh Khan to Conway, no run, good length and stops a bit on the surface, Conway tried to dab it down and it looked like he got an edge, but short of Pooran
Avesh Khan to Conway, 1 run, pitched up on off, Conway shuffles closer for a tap towards mid-off. Risky single but gets there and will retain strike..
Mayers to Conway, 1 run, full and angling away from off. Conway just guides it towards cover point for a single
Mayers to Gaikwad, , touch of class!! Too full outside off, Ruturaj Gaikwad with a superb square drive. Between point and short third for a boundary
Mayers to Gaikwad, 2 runs, full and swinging onto the pads, turned towards deep backward square leg and Gaikwad was always confident that he'll make it back for the second run
Mayers to Gaikwad, 1 run, good length with in swing, thickish inside edge towards long-on
Mayers to Conway, 1 run, nice and full on off, driven down the ground but mid-off makes a nice stop...
Mayers to Gaikwad, 1 run, length ball onto the thigh pad, turned towards deep square leg
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, flat delivery, cut towards covers who half stops
Krunal Pandya to Conway, no run, short delivery, Conway wanted to slap it over the infield but is late on his shot. Goes tamely towards mid-on
Krunal Pandya to Conway, 1 run, short again on the thigh pad, pulled towards deep backward square leg
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, flat on off, punched towards extra cover
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, , short but comes in with the arm onto leg, Gaikwad rocks back and guides his pull over mid-on. One bounce and four...
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, once again the arm ball, turned towards deep mid-wicket

LSG have done a mistake!! This is a dangerous opening pair and if they settles down it will be very hard to keep them calm, Rahul should have introduced Mark Wood early into the attack considering the way he has bowled in last match.
Gowtham to Gaikwad, no run, pitched up on off, driven straight to extra cover
Gowtham to Gaikwad, , short and straight, Gaikwad stays back and whacks it over the bowler's head. Back hand slap down the ground for six!!
Gowtham to Gaikwad, no run, short and extra bounce. Gaikwad stays back and controls it into the ground

Gowtham to Gaikwad, , What a shot!! Gowtham tried shorter length, that disappeared. Now pitches it up on off, this time Gaikwad extends his arms on the drive down the ground. Over long-off for another six

Gowtham to Gaikwad, , What a shot!! Gowtham tried shorter length, that disappeared. Now pitches it up on off, this time Gaikwad extends his arms on the drive down the ground. Over long-off for another six
Pitches here are known to be spin-friendly , but today's track is a bit different, looks like a batter's paradise.
Gowtham to Gaikwad, 2 runs, short again, down the ground off the backfoot. The timing isn't perfect on this and Hooda from long-on will cut it off
Gowtham to Gaikwad, , Ruturaj is off to a flier again!! This time dances down the track as soon as the bowler releases, takes it on the pitch and lifts his drive over wide long-off for six.
Mark Wood to Conway, , good length on off, an uppish push by Conway but there is no extra cover in place. Finds that gap and runs away for four...
Mark Wood to Conway, byes, , banged in short on off, goes over Conway's pull and over Pooran's jump. Four byes...
Mark Wood to Conway, , 140.7 clicks hard length ball on the body, pulled at double the pace through deep backward square leg. Played with disdain there by Devon Conway!!
Mark Wood to Conway, 1 run, good length on off from round the wicket. Conway taps it into the pitch on the off side and takes off for a single...
Mark Wood to Gaikwad, , length ball on the pads at some serious pace, Ruturaj Gaikwad gives it just a gentle flick and the ball lands over the deep backward square leg ropes.
Mark Wood to Gaikwad, no run, I0$, full on off and Gaikwad pushes it towards mid-off

All CSK on their return to Chepauk. Kyle Mayers has been the only bowler who has was sort of economical, rest everyone has disappeared for plenty. The break and the end of the powerplay comes at a good time for KL Rahul, let's see what's his Plan B
Yash Thakur to Conway, 1 run, pitched up and looked like the cutter, driven towards long-on
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, hard length with a straight line, pulled to the right of long-on
Ruturaj is such a treat to watch. Such grace, technique and ease with the way he plays. Absolute treat to the eyes, he's got to a fiery start just needs to capitalise on this and take it all the way.

OO Cricket, what a leveler you are! 
Man of the match in the last game, Being taken to the cleaners here!
Yash Thakur to Conway, 1 run, banged in short and surprises Conway with the extra bounce. Off the glove towards square leg as the southpaw went to pull
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, no run, short of length and angling in from off. An uppish push on the leg side that falls of the bowler
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, short of length again, pulled tamely towards deep mid-wicket
i am in Bengaluru, but still can hear cheers from Chepauk stadium.
How badly CSK might have missed Chepauk!! This is one heck of a start. Roars all over.
Yash Thakur to Conway, , 1 run, full on middle and the bowlers falls over after landing that delivery. Turned towards deep mid-wicket. Oops,
Yash Thakur to Conway, , 1 run, full on middle and the bowlers falls over after landing that delivery. Turned towards deep mid-wicket. Oops,
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, full and straight at normal pace, slapped hard back towards the bowler who parries it towards long-on.
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, tossed up onto leg, driven towards long-on and that's
Krunal Pandya to Conway, 1 run, fired full and wide, Conway danced out and drives powerfully towards long-off
Krunal Pandya to Gaikwad, leg byes, 1 run, in between length and angles in. Gaikwad stepped out and checked himself to get a leading edge towards point
Krunal Pandya to Conway, , tossed up, Conway goes for it and gets it off the sweet spot of the bat on his slog. Over long-on, well over long-on despite that being the bigger boundary...
Krunal Pandya to Conway, no run, flat and straight, pushed back to Pandya
Krunal Pandya to Conway, , fired full outside off, Conway slams it at triple the pace over long-on for another six. He's reminding everyone he's out there too.
Curdy its because u have ur tv on
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, , banged in short and puzzles Gaikwad who danced out. He wasn't in control as the ball just flies off his bat and luckily goes over short fine's head.
Oh Ruturaj!! How can u be so stylish and the most destructive at the same time. I think he is up for a 600-700 runs season and could well be a tough competitor for Butter for Orange cap.
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, hard length outside off, cut towards deep extra cover
Yash Thakur to Conway, 1 run, slower delivery on off, dabbed towards backward point for a single
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, good length and straight, Gaikwad backed away to cut it square of the wicket
Yash Thakur to Conway, leg byes, 1 run, good length and angling in from round the wicket. Keeps lower and Conway can't pull. Deflects off his pads towards point
Yash Thakur to Gaikwad, 1 run, good length on the body, was the slower one again. Pulled towards deep backward square leg
Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad,  Caught!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad,  Caught by Mark Wood!! First ball wicket for Ravi Bishnoi. Where were you hiding him all these overs, KL Rahul? This is flighted up and was there for the big drive, Gaikwad takes it on but gets a leading edge that almost flies over short third. But Mark Wood leaps in time to complete a superb catch.

Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad,  Caught by Mark Wood!! First ball wicket for Ravi Bishnoi. Where were you hiding him all these overs, KL Rahul? This is flighted up and was there for the big drive, Gaikwad takes it on but gets a leading edge that almost flies over short third. But Mark Wood leaps in time to complete a superb catch.
Promotion for Shivam Dube. Interesting choice...
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, no run, straight up the googly to the left-hander. Cut towards short cover, dot ball
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, no run, another googly, this was fuller. Pushed towards covers but once again in the direction of the fielder
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, 1 run, pitched up and strightens onto middle. Guided towards backward point for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Conway, no run, googly outside off, cut towards Mayers at extra cover
Ravi Bishnoi to Conway, 3 runs, to deep mid-wicket
Mark Wood to Conway, , hard length on middle, Devon Conway gives it a backhand smash down the ground. It goes straight and keeps running away from Mayers who chased after from mid-off
Mark Wood to Conway,  Caught!!

Mark Wood to Conway,  Caught by Krunal Pandya! Stunning catch! This was banged in short and Conway goes for the pull. Doesn't get the timing and gets only elevation. It looked like it would land short of the fielder but Pandya from deep backward square leg runs in and times his dive perfectly. The ball just lands into his hands as he falls down, LSG's fielding has been top notch!
Mark Wood to Moeen Ali, 1 run, hard length on off from over the wicket, Moeen gets a thick inside edge on his defence towards square leg
Mark Wood to Shivam Dube, no run, nice short ball. Dube has to leave and really solid jumping take by keeper Pooran
Mark Wood to Shivam Dube, 1 run, predictably short again, Dube backed away and just guided it towards third-man
Mark Wood to Moeen Ali, no run, I0$ nice and straight length ball. Blocked towards backward point
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, 1 run, full and quick onto the pads. Dube gets an edge towards short fine as he goes for a slog. There's an umpire review for run out, but Moeen is home
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, no run, lovely googly!! Totally beats Moeen Ali on the outside edge
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, 1 run, flat onto the thigh pad, turned to the leg side for a quick single
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, 1 run, flat onto the thigh pad, turned to the leg side for a quick single
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, 1 run, another googly at a decent pace, Dube cleared his legs for a slap down the ground. Poor connection and goes tamely towards long-off after pitching
Everyone is thinking of bowling depth of LSG, but have look at CSK they have 10 batsmen where everyone can be destructive.
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, 2 runs, fuller on leg, turned softly towards deep mid-wicket to complete the second run
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, no run, full onto leg, Moeen Ali goes for a flick but can't connect
Yash Thakur to Shivam Dube, 1 run, hard length on off, backfoot punched to the right of mid-off
Yash Thakur to Moeen Ali, 1 run, pace off length ball outside off, cut towards the sweeper
Yash Thakur to Shivam Dube, no run, hard length and goes over the stumps. A heave and a miss for Shivam Dube
Yash Thakur to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short again, takes advantage of the 6ft4 Shivam Dube - very difficult to bounce it over him! Dube let it pass
CSK is again losing their momentum after the start given by Rutu just like the last match.
Yash Thakur to Shivam Dube, , how badly Shivam Dube needed that shot!! This is pitched up on off, under the bat and Dube flat bats it straight as an arrow for a six!!
Yash Thakur to Shivam Dube, , short on middle, Dube pulls pretty convincingly and that goes to the right of deep mid-wicket. One bounce and four
Nithin  Hangergekar can bat too
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali, 1 run, tossed up ball, pushed towards backward point off the outer part of the bat

Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, , 97kph, dropped short and Shivam Dube pounces. Stands tall, clears his front leg and slams it over wide long-on. It was the googly but the length was too short. 102m six!
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, , back-to-back sixes! 102.9kph, quicker and fuller, this time it's right in the slot, Shivam Dube swings his bat hard to thump it over long-on
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube, no run, 95.6kph, swing and a miss! Googly from a length, Shivam Dube tries to flog this across the line and gets beaten on the outside edge
Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube,  Caught!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Shivam Dube,  Caught by Mark Wood!! Gone! 93.7kph, Ravi Bishnoi is pumped up. Another wrong 'un, Shivam Dube shapes up to slog over mid-wicket. Loses his shape as he tries to over-hit. The ball lobs up off the top-edge and it's a straightforward catch for Wood at short third man.

LSG is still in the match as they have match-winners in their batting line up and CSK has bowled poorly in the recent match. It is going to be a test for the CSK bowling lineup to resist the LSG batters.
A slip in place
Ravi Bishnoi to Stokes, no run, 95.6kph, googly, Stokes goes back in his crease and watchfully defends it towards backward point
Ravi Bishnoi to Stokes, no run, 95.6kph, googly, Stokes goes back in his crease and watchfully defends it towards backward point
Avesh Khan to Moeen Ali, 1 run, 131.4kph, away-angling length ball, slapped towards cover for a quick single
Avesh Khan to Stokes, no run, 129.9kph, Stokes skips down the track and punches to point who has a shy at the bowler's end. The batters can't steal a single
Avesh Khan to Stokes, 1 run, back of a length delivery, tucked away to deep mid-wicket

Avesh Khan to Moeen Ali, , 127.7kph, slow and full outside off, Moeen Ali spots it and beautifully plays an aerial drive over extra cover. The man in the deep runs across and dives to his left but to no avail

Avesh Khan to Moeen Ali, , 121.6kph, beats extra cover to his left on this occasion does Moeen Ali. Pace off again, Moeen Ali stands tall and throws his bat at it to flay it past the fielder. No chance for long-off to cut it off

Avesh Khan to Moeen Ali, , hat-trick of fours for Moeen Ali! 129.8kph, yorker length outside off, Moeen Ali stays back and opens his bat-face to squeeze it away between short third man and backward point. Excellent placement
Ravi Bishnoi to Stokes, , 96.6kph, full down the leg-side, Stokes misses the sweep
Ravi Bishnoi to Stokes, 1 run, cut away to deep point
Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali,  Stumped!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Moeen Ali,  Stumped!! Third wicket for Ravi Bishnoi! Another googly at 96.5kph, Moeen Ali had danced down the track a long way for a mighty swing across the line. Bishnoi probably saw that and shortened his length. The ball turns away past the swinging blade and Pooran does the rest.
Ravi Bishnoi has bowled beautifully amidst the carnage. There's still a lot of firepower to come for CSK.
My Childhood Fantasy got fulfilled after watching Ruturaj's Six hitting the car.
Excellent spell from Ravi Bishnoi !!
I hope Bishnoi gets more chances internationally after this IPL season, his bowling has been world-class today.
Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, no run, 99.5kph, quick leggie, Rayudu shapes up to slogsweep and connects with thin air
Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, no run, 97.7kph, shorter outside off, cut hard but straight to backward point

Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, , Rayudu gets off the mark with a boundary! In-drifter from Bishnoi, Rayudu gets down on one leg and sweeps hard over backward square leg. Off the inner part of the bat but the ball has the legs to reach the fence
Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, no run, 100.6kph, fired in quicker, Rayudu skips down, takes it on the full and drills it straight back at the bowler.
Avesh Khan to Stokes, 1 run, 132.1kph, short of a good length, Stokes backs away and heaves it to deep mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to Stokes, 1 run, 132.1kph, short of a good length, Stokes backs away and heaves it to deep mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, 132.8kph, Rayudu walks across and pulls this short ball over backward square leg
Avesh Khan to Stokes, 1 run, 136.7kph, low full toss, Stokes clears his front leg and drills it to sweeper cover
Avesh Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, 132.7kph, Avesh Khan slips in a yorker and that's been jammed down the pitch
Avesh Khan to Stokes, , 135.5kph, Avesh Khan slightly errs with his length as he goes for the yorker. Stokes hangs back, manages to get under it and tonks it over wide mid-off for a one-bounce four
Avesh Khan to Stokes,  Caught!!

Avesh Khan to Stokes,  Caught by Yash Thakur!! 123.4kph, pace off, full in length, Stokes gets down on one leg and is early into his slog across the line. The ball loops up off the outer edge and Thakur takes a safe catch at backward point.

Mark Wood to Rayudu, , wow! 143kph, that's a stylish shot from Rayudu. Walks across towards off and uses the bowler's pace and angle to his advantage. Brings his wrists into play to whip it over backward square leg. Short boundary and the man in the deep is just a spectator
Mark Wood to Rayudu, 1 run, , banged in short, Rayudu gets inside the line to hook. Hits him on the glove and falls in the no-man's land around backward square leg
Mark Wood to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length delivery, Jadeja is late to close his bat-face and the ball thuds into his thigh pad
Mark Wood to Rayudu, , shot! Rayudu goes downtown.  and Rayudu shimmies down the track to it. Converts it into a half-volley and smashes through the line. Wow, that came right off the meat of the bat
Mark Wood to Rayudu, 1 run, , very full and darted in, a shuffling Rayudu manages to flick it away to backward square leg

Mark Wood to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, , well-directed bumper, Jadeja takes his eyes off it as he tries to pull and the ball goes towards third man off his helmet. It was a cross-seam ball. Replays show that it went off the batter's shoulder
Yash Thakur to Jadeja, 1 run, 121.8kph, back of a length ball, punched towards long-off
Yash Thakur to Rayudu, 1 run, 136.9kph, heaved to deep mid-wicket
Yash Thakur to Jadeja, 1 run, 137.9kph, yorker, Jadeja can't get under it, squeeze-driven to long-on
Yash Thakur to Rayudu, , just over shor third man! Slower delivery into the pitch, Rayudu opens his bat-face and slices it over the leaping Avesh at short third man
Yash Thakur to Rayudu, , just over shor third man! Slower delivery into the pitch, Rayudu opens his bat-face and slices it over the leaping Avesh at short third man
Yash Thakur to Rayudu, 1 run, forced to deep extra cover
Yash Thakur to Jadeja, 1 run, dug in short and that's been pulled through backward square leg
Wood to bowl the final over. KL Rahul and Stoinis in his ears.  is near the boundary rope and he comes in as the  He replaces Avesh Khan
Mark Wood to Jadeja,  Caught!!

Mark Wood to Jadeja,  Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!! , hit-the-deck-hard length ball, Jadeja clears his front leg to heave it over mid-wicket. The timing isn't great and it's the longer boundary. Bishnoi gobbles it up at deep mid-wicket.
The Chennai crowd go berserk as their I0$ MSD walks out to the middle.

Mark Wood to Dhoni, ,  148.7kph, width served and Dhoni flashes his bat hard. Quick hands from the skipper and the ball flies over third man. No chance for Badoni to catch that. Wood has his hands on head
Mark Wood to Dhoni, , that's a biggie! Stays back, fetches this short ball from outside off and slams the pull over deep square leg. Back-to-back sixes! The crowd going bonkers. Three more balls left
Mark Wood to Dhoni,  Caught!!

Mark Wood to Dhoni,  Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!!  That was bowled at  by Mark Wood. On a length and wide of off, Dhoni throws the kitchen sink at it and ends up slicing it in the air. Easy catch for Bishnoi at deep cover.
Mark Wood to Santner, 1 run, , back of a length delivery, Santner backs away to slap it towards mid-off
Mark Wood to Rayudu, 1 run, , heaved away to backward square leg off the inner part of the bat.

Phew! CSK, back home, post a mammoth total on the board. Their openers got them off to a blazing start. Just one over to get their eye in, both Ruturaj Gaikwad and Conway were quick to get off their blocks quickly. While there was some poor bowling as well, the openers played some outstanding shots. The fifty was up in the fifth over, smashed 79 runs in the powerplay, Gaikwad got to his half-ton in just 25 balls and CSK crossed the 100-run mark in the eighth over. KL Rahul summoned Ravi Bishnoi only after nine overs and the legspinner struck with his first ball removing the in-form Gaikwad. Conway followed him in the very next over. LSG kept a lid on the scoring rate for a couple of overs but the platform was set for all the CSK batters to play with full freedom.

Dube struck three sixes and a four in four balls before being bamboozled by Bishnoi. Moeen Ali hit a hat-trick of fours and he too was done in by a Bishnoi googly who finished with impressive figures of 3/28. Rayudu played a cameo as well but it needed two sixes from MSD in the final over to bring the house down at Chepauk. Right then, how will LSG fare with the bat? Let's find out...

Don't know why but Dhoni is underutilising himself as a batter from the last couple of seasons. I feel he should be there batting at the death atleast from 15/16th over and it will be good for CSK if he can face atleast 15-20 deliveries..
"Dhoni asked for a DRS for No ball on 19.3, what happened?" -- It looked like he thought it should have been called one bouncer for the over. And then signalled for a review in jest. Not sure though.
Goosebumps hearing the crowd when MSD hit those sixes. Surreal!

It was a great start tonight, the way Rutu played- that first six was pretty special. Took the pressure off me. He is sneakily strong, holds his shape really well and uses his hands well. The slower ball into the wicket might be a good option. Pretty difficult to hit due to the unpredictability of speeds. With the spinners, some skid on so if we hit the right lengths batting can be difficult. Very special feeling when I got here earlier. The crowd was pretty loud, really great atmosphere and watching MS go out there for the last over was pretty special. The message has been to just go out there and enjoy ourselves.
Welcome back for the chase.  Chahar has the new ball in his hand. A slip in place. Mayers got the ball to swing but wasn't spot-on with his lines. Will LSG attack from the word go? Let's find out...
Chahar to Rahul, no run, short of length ball, Rahul stands tall and pats it to cover
Chahar to Rahul, no run, 129.3kph, similar length, hint of away movement, pushed to backward point
Chahar to Rahul, 2 runs, Chahar goes full and gets it to curl away outside off, Rahul throws his bat at it and slices it over covers and gets off the mark for a brace
Chahar to Rahul, , short ball, no venom to trouble the batter. Rahul has ample time to pick his spot. Pulls neatly over square leg and the ball bullets away
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, full ball swinging away, driven to sweeper cover
A slip in position for Mayers as well. MSD taking his time to set the field....
Chahar to Mayers, no run, Mayers gets squared up and is hit on the thumb. Bit of extra bounce from a length and Mayers stayed back to defend. Bit of away movement as well off the deck
Stokes is bowling! He can swing the ball too. A lsip in place
Stokes to Rahul, 2 runs, 130.9kph, Stokes starts with a length ball, leg-lined and that's been worked away to deep backward square leg
Stokes to Rahul, 1 run, 131.1kph, in-slanting short of length ball, punched towards cover point
Deep backward point and deep mid-wicket in place for Mayers
Stokes to Mayers, , 131.8kph, width served outside off, Mayers rocks back and slaps the cut over cover point
Stokes to Mayers, , back-to-back fours for Mayers! Stokes goes fuller, Mayers slightly crouches and lifts it over Rahul's head. Hit through the line
Stokes to Mayers, , even better! Slot ball from Stokes, full and outside off, allows Mayers to get under it. The left-hander tonks it over long-off. Clean hit for an 86m six
Stokes to Mayers, 1 run, keeps the strike with a single. Mayers knocks this length ball towards mid-on.

Chahar to Mayers, no run, in the air and safe! 131.2kph, short of a good length ball around leg, Mayers is early to close his bat-face and the ball lobs over the bowler before falling well in front of mid-on

Chahar to Mayers, no run, in the air and safe! 131.2kph, short of a good length ball around leg, Mayers is early to close his bat-face and the ball lobs over the bowler before falling well in front of mid-on
Chahar to Mayers, , 132.9kph, Chahar foles doles out width. Hint of extra bounce, but Mayers rocks back and plays an uppish punch to find the gap between cover and cover point
Chahar to Mayers, no run, 116.8kph, pace off, Mayers doesn't pick it and is early into his drive. Beaten on the outside edge
Chahar to Mayers, , Mayers clears his front leg, Chahar goes wider from a shortish length. The batter can't reach out for this and it's been wided
"With that spectacular 2nd six, Dhoni completed 5000 runs in IPL career..!! #MSD" -- Yes he did, becoming only the 7th player to do so in IPL!
Chahar to Mayers, , short and Mayers hammers the pull through square leg. It was probably off-speed and Mayers punished him. Moves to 23 off 9!
Chahar to Mayers, , Chahar switches to round the wicket and bowls a low full toss outside off. Mayers neatly drives it through extra cover. Easily done!
Chahar to Mayers, no run, 114.7kph, overpitched outside off, driven hard and straight to cover. Another good over for LSG - 13 off it!
Will Dhoni turn to spin? No, it's going to the impact player
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, no run, lovely ball first up! Good shape away from the right-hander from a fullish length, Rahul drives with no feet movement and is beaten on the outside edge
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 1 run, 137.9kph, outswinger, cut hard towards backward point. A slight fumble allows the batters to rotate strike
Mayers vs decock headache for LSG
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, 2 runs, away-angler, a punchy-drive to deep extra cover follows. Santner makes a sliding stop to his left
CSK bowling seems to lack any bite!!!
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , , pacy yorker, just inside the tramline outside off. Mayers fails to lay bat on ball. The siren goes off as Deshpande has overstepped
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , this time, he errs with his line as he goes for the wide yorker. Left alone. The free-hit stays

Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , overpitched outside off, Mayers smashes it hard and straight to extra cover. Caught by Chahar and the crowd cheer, but it was a free-hit. Oh, Deshpande has overstepped again
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , , Deshpande sprays a full toss way outside off, Mayers slashes and misses. Wided
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , , full toss outside off, Mayers shuffles across and swings hard. Loses his shape but gets enough elevation to clear Conway at mid-off

"Why is QDK not available in LSG?? If he comes, it will be a tough choice considering the dynamics that Mayers provide to the team. A cracking opener, can chip in some overs too and also a excellent fielder." -- He was part of South Africa's team for the series against Netherlands, which concluded yesterday. He should be available from their next match.
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , 114.6kph, Deshpande tries the slower ball and that's barely touched the deck. Too wide outside off and Mayers shoulders arms. 50 up for LSG and Deshpande under the pump!
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , 137.6kph, short of a good length ball, Mayers shuffles across and muscles it over long-on for a maximum! Moved across a long way and swatted it away
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, , 137.6kph, short of a good length ball, Mayers shuffles across and muscles it over long-on for a maximum! Moved across a long way and swatted it away
Tushar Deshpande to Mayers, no run, , yorker length outside off, jammed towards mid-on who makes a diving stop to his right.
Chahar to continue...
Chahar to Rahul, 2 runs, short of length ball, punched to deep backward point for a brace
Ravi: KL being the captain should move down for the sake of the team.
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, slower and shorter, cut to sweeper cover
Chahar to Mayers, , Mayers is toying with the CSK bowlers. Off-speed short ball from round the wicket, Mayers spots it, waits and pulls over square leg
CSK bowling looks weak. No targets feel safe with this attack.
Chahar to Mayers, , Mayers backs away, Chahar bowls an off-speed short ball wide of off. Left alone and that's been wided for line by umpire Bruce Oxenford
Chahar to Mayers, , knuckle ball, short and outside off, a hopping Mayers slaps it into the gap between cover point and extra cover. Chahar is struggling with his line and length
Chahar to Mayers, 1 run, guided to the left of short third man who makes a diving stop
Chahar to Rahul, , 118.9kph, pace off again, Rahul sees that coming. Has ample time to pull it away over mid-wicket. Not quite off the middle but it's another boundary.
The asking rate is under 10RPO. Spin time...

Moeen Ali to Mayers, 5 runs, 96.7kph, oh dear! Punched to extra cover for a single. A wild and needless throw at the bowler's end and the ball speeds away to the fence. CSK gifting runs.  His second fifty in as many matches...
sakar: LSG might keep Mayers and replace quinny with stoin. One of the three openers will move to no 3. most likely KL
The umpires having a chat to check if it was 4 runs or 5 runs. Mayers had completed the single - so, it's five runs...
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, moves leg-side and push-drives towards mid-off to give the strike to Mayers
Moeen Ali to Mayers,  Caught!!

Moeen Ali to Mayers,  Caught by Conway!! Moeen Ali strikes in his first over! 94.6kph, fullish delivery on middle, Mayers gets down on one leg to slogsweep and hits it straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. There was just one fielder around that region in the deep and Conway barely had to move. Some relief for CSK. But Mayers has done his job, got his team off to a flier.
Moeen Ali to Hooda, no run, clipped to mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Hooda, no run, 92.4kph, Hooda stays leg-side of the ball to play an inside-out drive and is beaten on the outside edge
Moeen Ali to Hooda, no run, 92.4kph, Hooda stays leg-side of the ball to play an inside-out drive and is beaten on the outside edge
Moeen Ali to Hooda, 1 run, extra bounce from a length, a shuffling Hooda turns it to mid-wicket.
Spin from both ends...
Santner to Hooda, 1 run, full delivery, Hooda eases the drive to long-off
There's a slip in place
Santner to Rahul, no run, dots being cheered. Length ball holds onto the pitch a bit, Rahul stays back and hurriedly brings his bat down to keep it out
Santner to Rahul, no run, moves leg-side and chops into the off-side off the under-edge
Santner to Rahul, 1 run, driven along the carpet to sweeper cover
Santner to Hooda, no run, comes down the track to drive and outside-halves it to backward point
Santner to Hooda,  Caught!!

Santner to Hooda,  Caught by Stokes!! Spin introduced and LSG lose two wickets in two overs! Hooda gets down on one leg to slogsweep and doesn't middle it. Hits it flat as well. Stokes runs to his right from long-on and jumps to gobble it up.
Moeen Ali to Rahul, no run, steps out, isn't quite to the pitch and knocks it back to Moeen
Moeen Ali to Rahul,  Caught!!

Moeen Ali to Rahul,  Caught by Gaikwad!! Oh has this game turned around or what! Serious impact from the spinners as another one departs! Floated up around off, it's in the slot for Rahul who goes for the slog-sweep. But he's hitting to the big side, and the connection isn't good enough. Gaikwad takes the catch at deep midwicket!
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, length ball on off, Stoinis goes for the reverse-sweep first ball and paddles it to short third
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya, no run, sliding through towards off, back of a length, Krunal punches it to cover
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya, no run, dances down and knocks it to cover as he's not to the pitch
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flat on off, back of a length, Krunal punches it off the back foot to long-on
Santner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run,  as he floats it up on off. Krunal looks to drive down the ground but gets it off a thick inside edge through square leg!
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, slow through the air, tossed up on off, Stoinis gets forward and drives to long-off

Santner to Krunal Pandya, , good use of the feet here. Krunal runs down the track, gets close enough to it and swings hard through the line. It's not the cleanest connection, but he still clears the long-on boundary
Santner to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, 1 run, darted in on leg, back of a length, Krunal looks to pull but it goes off his thigh
Santner to Stoinis, 2 runs, 97.4kph, back of a length just outside off, and Stoinis cuts it through point for a couple
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, 96.7kph, back of a length just outside off, and Stoinis punches it off the back foot through point
Timeout! So it's the familiar weapon from CSK that's got them back into it. They seemed to be in serious trouble the way Mayers was going. But the introduction of spin has turned things around.
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, , here goes Stoinis! Floated up on off, right in the slot for him and he whacks it over long-on with a ferocious swing!
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, flat length ball on leg, Stoinis nudges it into the square leg region
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, punched off the back foot to long-on
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis not happy with himself. Short ball on middle, he makes room and slaps it through point only for a single. He feels he should've done more with it
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya, no run, full around off, Pandya gets forward and pushes it to cover
Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya,  Caught!!

Moeen Ali to Krunal Pandya,  Caught by Jadeja!! Moeen gets his third! What a spell this is turning out to be! Krunal dances down, looks to go straight for a big hit but he's not to the pitch of it. Yet he tries going through with the shot and miscues it off the inside half right down long-on's throat. Jadeja's not dropping that ever.
Santner to Stoinis, no run, floated up on off, Stoinis pushes it to cover
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, 97kph, flat length ball outside off, Stoinis hangs back and punches it to sweeper cover
Stoinis also got the opportunity to prove himself. Otherwise , QDK replacing him next match.
Santner to Pooran, 1 run, 90.3kph, flat length ball outside off, Pooran hangs back, plays late and dabs it to short third
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, 96.5kph, full outside off, Stoinis reaches out and drives to sweeper cover
Santner to Pooran, 1 run, back of a length around middle, Pooran stays in the crease and tucks it behind square
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, length ball turning away outside off, Stoinis punches it to cover
RS Hangargekar to Stoinis, 1 run, short of length outside off, Stoinis gets on his toes and gently punches off the back foot through cover
RS Hangargekar to Pooran, no run, short of length around off, Pooran hops back and steers to backward point
RS Hangargekar to Pooran, ,  Full delivery slanted in on off, right in the hitting arc for Pooran who swipes it over midwicket. Goes a long way back into the stands!
RS Hangargekar to Pooran, , 137kph, back of a length outside off, and Pooran cuts beautifully through backward point! Oh what timing on it!
RS Hangargekar to Pooran, ,  Full delivery outside off at 135kph, Pooran goes hard at it and carves it over extra cover. Don't think he got it off the middle, but it clears the infield comfortably
RS Hangargekar to Pooran, no run, short of length into the body, Pooran looks to pull but he's late on it! The ball strikes him on the body. Productive over for LSG though,
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, Santner bowls this quite wide outside off, making Stoinis reach out. He mistimes the drive to long-off
Santner to Pooran, 1 run, smartly bowled. Pooran steps out but finds that the length is on the shorter side. He still tries slogging hard, and drags it off a thick under-edge behind square
Santner to Stoinis, no run, pushed to cover

Santner to Stoinis, no run, floated up very wide outside off, would've been outside the marker if Stoinis had left it alone. But he reaches out, crunches it and there's a good diving stop at extra cover
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, again quite wide outside off, and perhaps not the smartest choice of shot from Stoinis here as he looks to pull. Drags it off the toe-end to long-on
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run, again quite wide outside off, and perhaps not the smartest choice of shot from Stoinis here as he looks to pull. Drags it off the toe-end to long-on
Santner to Pooran, no run, flat length ball on off, Pooran hangs back and defends

Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 2 runs, 95kph, flat length ball on middle, Stoinis sits on one knee and sweeps it through the square leg region. It's a chase for deep backward square and Stoinis comfortably gets back for two
Moeen Ali to Stoinis,  Bowled!!

Moeen Ali to Stoinis,  Bowled!! This is Moeen's final over and he's now got a wicket in every single one of them! Pushed through flat on middle, Stoinis backs away, looks to pull hard but it sneaks under him, hitting the top of leg stump.
Moeen Ali to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, flat length ball on leg, Badoni tucks it through square leg
Moeen Ali to Ayush Badoni, ,  But it's a wide as the ball finishes down the leg-side
Moeen Ali to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, fired into the pads, back of a length, and Badoni clips it through square leg
Moeen Ali to Pooran, 1 run, flat length ball around off, Pooran gets forward and taps it wide of cover
Moeen Ali to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, 95kph, flat length ball around off, Badoni hangs back and nudges it into the on-side. A brilliant spell comes to an end from Moeen who gets a pat from his teammates!
Timeout!
Jadeja to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, 92.6kph, full around off, Badoni gets forward and knocks it wide of cover
Jadeja to Pooran, no run,  Jadeja fires this on a length quite wide outside off, 98kph, and there's a big swing from Pooran! Doesn't connect!
Jadeja to Pooran, , now the length is a bit fuller, and  Goes like a rocket over the ropes!
Jadeja to Pooran, no run, fired in full around off, Pooran swings very hard, maybe loses his shape slightly and gets an inside edge onto pad
Jadeja to Pooran, , oh this is an unbelievable shot!  Wow! Fired in full, Pooran switches around, swings madly and whacks it over cover
Jadeja to Pooran, , oh this is an unbelievable shot!  Wow! Fired in full, Pooran switches around, swings madly and whacks it over cover
Jadeja to Pooran, 1 run, fired into the pads on leg stump, and Pooran flicks it through square leg for a single

Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, no run, full and wide, Pooran steps across the stumps to scoop as fine leg is in the ring. But he gets an under-edge that rolls to the fielder. Dhoni claps and applauds the execution from Deshpande!
Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, 1 run, again full and wide, this time Pooran stays put and slices it to deep backward point
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, 120kph, back of a length on leg, Badoni hangs back and nudges it gently behind square for a couple

Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, two more with a gentle nudge into the on-side! Short of length just outside off, Badoni tucks it into the midwicket region, plays it softly and charges back for a couple
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, 139.7kph, back of a length around off, Badoni punches off the back foot to long-on
Tushar Deshpande to Pooran,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Pooran,  Caught by Stokes!! The arms go up in delight! This has been a really good comeback from Deshpande after a difficult first over! Stuck to his plan of bowling wide to Pooran, and his execution has backed it up. Full and wide, Pooran reaches out, tries clubbing it down the ground but it goes flat to Stokes at long-off who makes no mistake.
Chahar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, short outside off, Badoni cuts it to sweeper cover
Chahar to Gowtham, 2 runs, slower short ball outside off, Gowtham slaps it through extra cover but the sweeper manages to cut it off
Chahar to Gowtham, , too wide outside off, left alone
Chahar to Gowtham, , again very wide from Chahar, and Gowtham lets it go
Chahar to Gowtham, , three wides in a row outside off! And none of them have been close either! Has missed his mark by a long way
Chahar to Gowtham, , now he abandons the plan of bowling wide outside off, bowls it on the stumps, and gets whacked! Full in the slot on middle, and it's slogged over midwicket for six!
Chahar to Gowtham, 2 runs, back of a length outside off, might've been off-pace and Gowtham punches it through backward point for a couple

Chahar to Gowtham, 2 runs,  Full and wide, Gowtham throws his bat at it, slices it up off the toe-end and it goes high in the air! Dube gets there comfortably after running across from short third, but fails to hang on

Chahar to Gowtham, 2 runs,  Full and wide, Gowtham throws his bat at it, slices it up off the toe-end and it goes high in the air! Dube gets there comfortably after running across from short third, but fails to hang on
Chahar to Gowtham, 2 runs, back of a length outside off, slower one, and it's swatted wide of long-on
It's 44 needed off 18!
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, it's a slower ball and Badoni tucks it through midwicket. He wanted to get back for two but is sent back!
Deshpande might want to bowl to the big leg-side boundary from this end
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, 1 run, slower bouncer, Gowtham under-edges the pull behind square and this time it's Gowtham who wants the second and Badoni isn't interested

Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, yorker on middle, Badoni squeezes it through midwicket and they charge back for two. Gowtham puts in a desperate dive at the non-striker's end. He might've hurt himself there. Gets a bit of attention from the physio
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, slower one dug into the pitch, Badoni tucks it down to long-on
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, 1 run, 141kph, speared in full around off, and Gowtham mistimes the attempted lofted shot towards long-off. It was there in the slot for him but he was late on it
Ayush badoni is not even showing intent!
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, slower length ball on leg, and Badoni merely clips it gently behind square for one. Only 7 off the over - nowhere near enough at this stage
Hangargekar with the ball now. Short leg-side boundary from this end, and LSG desperately need a huge over

RS Hangargekar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, as expected, Hangargekar bowls a wide line outside off, making Badoni reach for it. He slices it in the air off the outside half, and it lands short of deep backward point
RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, , goes for a wide yorker but misses his mark. It's outside the marker!
RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, no run, spot on from Hangargekar this time! Full and wide, Gowtham tries going after it but is beaten!
RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, , close call but probably the right one! Another wide yorker but it's just outside the marker! Gowtham leaves it alone
RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, no run, 136kph, nails the wide yorker and Gowtham swings and misses! Dhoni applauds from behind the stumps!

RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, , it's the same plan every ball from Hangargekar so far. And his execution is alternating between brilliant and just off the mark! Wide yorker that's not inside the marker and the umpire's arms go up

RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, 1 run, brilliant stop at the third man boundary! Anything Ruturaj can't do? Low full toss just outside off, Gowtham scoops it over short third and Ruturaj somehow gets to it, charging across from deep backward point and making a sliding stop

RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, 1 run, brilliant stop at the third man boundary! Anything Ruturaj can't do? Low full toss just outside off, Gowtham scoops it over short third and Ruturaj somehow gets to it, charging across from deep backward point and making a sliding stop

RS Hangargekar to Gowtham, 1 run, brilliant stop at the third man boundary! Anything Ruturaj can't do? Low full toss just outside off, Gowtham scoops it over short third and Ruturaj somehow gets to it, charging across from deep backward point and making a sliding stop
RS Hangargekar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, overpitched outside off, Badoni drives wide of long-off and gets two
RS Hangargekar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, overpitched outside off, Badoni drives wide of long-off and gets two
RS Hangargekar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, Badoni steps across the stumps and whips a low full toss over square leg who's in the ring. Hasn't connected that well though. Fielder chases it down!
RS Hangargekar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, Badoni steps across the stumps and whips a low full toss over square leg who's in the ring. Hasn't connected that well though. Fielder chases it down!
This will surely raise Deshpande's confidence, in fact he should be given the last over, if he succeeds, that will instil lots of confidence in him going forward in the IPL.
This will surely raise Deshpande's confidence, in fact he should be given the last over, if he succeeds, that will instil lots of confidence in him going forward in the IPL.
He missed his mark 2-3 times, but still an excellent over from 20-year old Hangargekar!
He missed his mark 2-3 times, but still an excellent over from 20-year old Hangargekar!
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, , banged in short outside off, and it's called a wide for height
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, , banged in short outside off, and it's called a wide for height
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, , leg byes, 1 run, Deshpande nails the yorker and Gowtham is struck on the toes as he looks to flick it away! Oh dear,
Tushar Deshpande to Gowtham, , leg byes, 1 run, Deshpande nails the yorker and Gowtham is struck on the toes as he looks to flick it away! Oh dear,
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, slower one on middle, deceives Badoni who's through the slog early and skies it off the toe-end. It lands in the midwicket region and they're back for two
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, slower one on middle, deceives Badoni who's through the slog early and skies it off the toe-end. It lands in the midwicket region and they're back for two
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, no run, now a fast length ball slanted in on leg, Badoni backs away looking to hit it over extra cover. But he's beaten on the edge!
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni, no run, now a fast length ball slanted in on leg, Badoni backs away looking to hit it over extra cover. But he's beaten on the edge!
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni,  Caught!!
Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni,  Caught by Dhoni!! Slower ball, Badoni advances down and swings hard. But he's through the shot early. It goes high in the air off the toe-end, and it's Dhoni getting under it, much to the delight of the Chennai crowd. Huge roar as he catches it.

Tushar Deshpande to Ayush Badoni,  Caught by Dhoni!! Slower ball, Badoni advances down and swings hard. But he's through the shot early. It goes high in the air off the toe-end, and it's Dhoni getting under it, much to the delight of the Chennai crowd. Huge roar as he catches it.
Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, no run, full outside off, Wood swings and misses
Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, no run, full outside off, Wood swings and misses
Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, , slower one in the slot outside off, Wood hammers it over mid-off
Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, , slower one in the slot outside off, Wood hammers it over mid-off

Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, , scythed over point for six! Back of a length at the stumps, Wood steps away from the stumps, makes room and crunches it! But it's not a shot that will dampen the spirits of this crowd who are busy celebrating a  in what has been a happy homecoming!

Tushar Deshpande to Mark Wood, , scythed over point for six! Back of a length at the stumps, Wood steps away from the stumps, makes room and crunches it! But it's not a shot that will dampen the spirits of this crowd who are busy celebrating a  in what has been a happy homecoming!

The crowd came in large numbers for CSK's return to Chepauk, and they've got what they wanted. Kyle Mayers had them silenced early on in the chase. It was again an extraordinary display of powerhitting from him, bringing up fifty off just 21 balls and getting LSG off to a flier. But the game turned around as soon as spin was brought on, with Moeen Ali bowling a superb spell, and Santner doing a brilliant job as well. That was just classic CSK in action at their fortress, with Dhoni pulling the right strings. LSG were 73/0 after the first 5 overs. But they had collapsed to 136/5 after 14, with Moeen picking up a wicket in each of his four overs. The turnaround was made all the more sweeter by Deshpande who overcame a poor start with the ball to execute some good plans at the death, getting rid of Nicholas Pooran in the process and putting the final nail in LSG's coffin.

The crowd came in large numbers for CSK's return to Chepauk, and they've got what they wanted. Kyle Mayers had them silenced early on in the chase. It was again an extraordinary display of powerhitting from him, bringing up fifty off just 21 balls and getting LSG off to a flier. But the game turned around as soon as spin was brought on, with Moeen Ali bowling a superb spell, and Santner doing a brilliant job as well. That was just classic CSK in action at their fortress, with Dhoni pulling the right strings. LSG were 73/0 after the first 5 overs. But they had collapsed to 136/5 after 14, with Moeen picking up a wicket in each of his four overs. The turnaround was made all the more sweeter by Deshpande who overcame a poor start with the ball to execute some good plans at the death, getting rid of Nicholas Pooran in the process and putting the final nail in LSG's coffin.

Not the ideal start after winning the toss. The first couple of overs it was a bit sticky and there was a bit of movement, but we did not bowl in the right areas and they got that flier. When you have quality batters in the opposition, they make you pay. Something for us to learn but the way Rutu and Conway played was brilliant. It does take time to learn what lengths to bowl on a surface, but to go for 70 odd in six overs isn’t ideal. We batted well but we didn’t capitalize the small momentum. Kyle (Mayers) is coming off good form, he was smoking them for West Indies and comes here with the same form and intent. Great to see what he’s done with the opportunity. Bishnoi is someone I’ve played with for a while, he gets wickets when things aren’t going well, puts his hand up and contains runs. Good to see different guys putting their hands up. Wouldn’t change the toss decision, we didn’t win because we didn’t capitalize the small moments. We had a good start but couldn’t press on. Not often we’ll find 4-5 guys caught on the boundary ropes, they needed to go over and will go over the next time. We’ll take that in T20 cricket, today the game didn’t go our way but this is the way we want to keep playing.

It was a pretty good wicket to bat on. Both powerplays looked challenging for the bowlers. Our job was to try and tie it up a little bit through the middle. It's always nice when Moeen takes a couple of wickets. On this wicket, it makes it easier with the boundary dimensions. I'm kinda used to that playing in New Zealand, we tend to play on one side of the block. It's a privilege to play any game, so I try to do my best. The wicket was a bit flatter than I wanted it. The last time we were here, it was spinning every game. Maybe as the tournament goes on, we might play a couple more spinners. It was awesome (to be back), had fond memories back in 2019. Nice to play in front of all these people tonight, they make it pretty loud. Sea of yellow, it's a privilege to play in front of them.

Terrific high-scoring game. All of us were thinking how the wicket would be. It was the perfect first game that could happen. I thought it would be much slower. But it was a wicket where you could score runs. I was quite surprised with the wicket. But we'll have to see if we can produce a wicket like this game after game. Fast bowling we need to slightly improve. Need to bowl according to the conditions. WHat is important is to keep an eye as to what the opposition bowlers are doing. One more thing is they'll have to bowl no no-balls or extra wides.  Only reason we've scored those runs is if the surface is nice.

They have big hitters. Almost tried to bowl like Test cricket. Tried to spin the ball. The combination was nice (with Santner). The partnership worked well. MS knows what he's doing. He knows when to bowl players. I do believe off-spinners can bowl to right-handers especially bowling to the big leg-side. I'm not going to bowl all the time with Jadeja there.

He knows when to bowl players. I do believe off-spinners can bowl to right-handers especially bowling to the big leg-side. I'm not going to bowl all the time with Jadeja there.

Four long years, and not much has changed. Chepauk remains a fortress for CSK and Dhoni remains its main attraction in front of adoring crowds who went berserk after those back-to-back sixes from their captain today. And of course, spin continues to hold sway here, though as Dhoni said, this pitch was much better to bat on. So that's it from us for now. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Saurabh Shankar, Abhinand Raghavendran, Siva and Harish. Goodnight!
